item.title: Fly Tipping of general waste in John Macnamara builders yard ,vans going inland out all day dumping rubbish ,lots of noise and dust,, 31st July
item.description:
There is a lot of Noise and dust clouds raised up from the site in the old wood yard based at John Macnamara site in Bestwood street, from dumping of waste ,unknown contents in an area of family and children with limited space for fresh air

item.title: Bins blocking footpath Eynella Rd, 31st July
item.description:
No need- 8 Eynella Rd Plenty of room on private space. Please get bin men to put in front yard. This is a school route and children must not be made to walk in road - dangerous. Plesse clamp down on such antisocial and dangerous behaviour.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Norcroft Gardens, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Household Waste all over pavement, 31st July
item.description:
This continues to be an issue... (see previous listing) there is still one week until household rubbish is collected... each property has a designated black top bin... here the rubbish continues to be fly tipped onto the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bramblebury Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 x Plastic Rubbish Sacks Dumped, 31st July
item.description:
Further to my notice report last week advising of regular occurrence fly tipping it has happened again last night, four plastic sacks dumped on the pavement by the bus stop across the road opposite 278/280 Westwood Lane.! Bexley Council need to catch these people whom are carrying this out, the disabled lady in the adjoining property to where this happens needs clear access for her mobility scooter to get past and enter the property through her side access gate, this is an accident waiting to happen!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westwood Lane, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet
